page.title: 19CULWORTH FAMILY LIFE 2
page.content: There are approximately 50 people of pensionable age living in Culworth.Most live with their spouse or children.5% are housebound.No one feels lonely, relatives and neighbours visit frequently.Pensions can be collected from the village P.O. Most use the village shops and travel to Banbury by car or bus.Popular holidays are touring Britain,visiting friends and relations. One 87yr old is still driving but most stop at 80. Several belong to {Culworth Gang} (the name derived from the original gang of highway robbers) and enjoy fortnightly meetings,speakers and visits.Many of the retired people are occupied with voluntary caring activities.The farmers didn't retire but gradually relinquished control.All take an interest in current affairs, natural history,etc ,through the media.
